content: Traditional indexes are market cap weighted. The market as a whole is market cap weighted. The portion that is not indexed (i.e. active) must also be market cap weighted for the sum of the 2 parts to equal the market. In other words, active in aggregate and passive hold the same stuff and whatever is cheaper will outperfom. This is just math as alpha is a zero sum game. Of course no one owns all of active and there is a chance to select the better active managers. Much easier said than done. The point is the debate active vs passive is settled easily with algebra. What is unsettled is whether good active can be identified with any reliability.
